Reviews.Title: “Peaceful place to stay out of the downtown Mecca”
Reviews.Author: advcards
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay, reminded me more of apartments than Condos. Staff was nice, seemed willing to help. On the downside a little to close to the road for sleeping as Grand Canyon Drive is busy and the front desk is hard to call from the room. On the plus side housekeeping was outstanding and called for one maintenance issue and they came within minutes. Would stay again the location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: RubySue2144
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Cliffs at Peace Canyon. The units were beautiful, as well as the grounds. The shuttle driver (Steve) to the strip was so helpful and entertaining. The shuttle service was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: YLugo
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome!! Just got back and miss it already. Perfect location, not too far from the strip at all. Felt like home...will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ELAINE B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from spending 11 nights here, after booking it nearly a year ago! We have kept up to date with reviews on trip advisor for this property and after staying here have to agree with all the positive comments posted. Getting there from the airport in our hire car was relatively easy, although John Cleese on our satnav did say we had arrived when the place was actually further on and round the corner, so we got a bit lost! My best recommendation is to look out for the big, grey boulder wall which is opposite the Cliffs and seemed to be the only wall like it in Vegas, so was a good landmark. Also watch out for the dangerous road intersection a few yards up from the property (on turning right out of the cliffs) as it just suddenly appears with no stop signs, and as driving etiquette is first come first served, you could easily have an accident- installing roundabouts would be a great idea for America!! Check in was easy, quick and very friendly. You park your car at the front and then are allocated your parking spot which is numbered the same as the unit you are staying in, so you always get the same spot which is very useful. The grounds are well kept with flower gardens, bushes, trees and tidy paved areas with gravel borders. We stayed in a one bed unit and these are spacious, clean, light and airy. The living area consisted of a large corner sofa that can be made into a spare bed, coffee table, TV and DVD player (DVD's can be rented for free and there is an extensive selection). Two large screened off (keeps out the bugs!) windows with shutters and curtains make the room warm and provide lots of light. The full size kitchen has everything you need: gas rings, electric oven, microwave, dishwasher,enormous fridge/freezer with ice maker, coffee percolator, kettle (nice touch as usually Americans do not provide kettles as they all drink coffee, so thanks for that!), blender, crockery/cutlery for 4, pots, pans, cooking dishes, washing up liquid and powder for dishwasher, tea towels and cloths. The only thing we found missing was a pair of scissors, but we coped with the extensive range of knives! The utility room has an ironing board, iron, washing basket, brush, fire extinguisher and a large, easy to use washer and dryer. A full load of washing can be done and dried in under an hour (unlike UK washers which take over an hour alone!). A small pack of washing powder is provided and when this has been used I thoroughly recommend popping to SMITHS supermarket and buying a small bottle of Tide (known as ariel actilift in UK: but is considerably better and smells lovely); Dining area has a large rectangular glass table and 4 chairs; A mini hi-fi with cassette deck, CD player and radio is provided which sounds great (I recommend station 96.3 KKLZ, which is a mix of 60's to 80's songs we all know in the UK). Outside balcony has small table and 2 chairs- we had a lovely view of the front entrance, so could watch all the activity and hot air balloons that came very close, as well as see the mountains in the distance. The bedroom has a massive (superking size) bed which is very comfortable,a TV and DVD player, bedside cabinets, stool and enormous walk-in wardrobe. The window has shutters and blackout curtains which is very useful after a late night! The good sized bathroom had a large marble worktop with basin, toilet (why are all American toilets so low to the ground??!!) and large oval shaped bath (very wide) with shower over. The whole bath is screened off with sliding doors (one of which was a bit dodgy and kept sliding off runners so we used other door!) and this is the best idea I have ever seen as it stops water going all over floor. There were loads of power sockets in each area. Our unit was upstairs so there are approx 20 steps to navigate (no lifts) but, as a person with a disabled knee I managed OK, although the gaps between the steps were not good for a fear of heights! The outside, warm pool was large (not small like some reviewer stated) with 2 waterfalls and easily accessible steps. A large, hot jacuzzi was also very welcoming after a long day of walking the strip/round hotels/ Grand Canyon etc. The pool area also has a section with barbecue grills, which seems popular with Americans, but is unusual for us Brits! There is also a gym and a few other games in reception. There is no shop/bar onsite but this is not a problem as everything you need is only a couple of minutes away in the car (or half hour plus on foot)- Sears, JCPenney, Kohls, Smiths supermarket (do not use Walmart as it is like doing the weekly shop in a wholesalers as the quantities are too big for us Brits!) plus all the usual takeways such as Burger King, McD's, pizza, KFC etc. A free shuttle bus can be booked 24 hours in advance which takes you to Smiths supermarket, the Mirage hotel and the Fremont Street experience/ Golden Nugget hotel and casino in downtown (a trip I highly recommend). Steve, one of the drivers, (a cockney who has lived in Vegas for over 20 years) is a wealth of knowledge with good advice and tips on how to get the best from Vegas and his help was much appreciated. The property is approx 6 miles from the Strip (15/20 mins by car) and is a welcome relief from the noise, lights, cigarette smoke (yes, readers, be warned that nicotine is rife in Vegas, inside casinos and everywhere outside on the strip: a fact that I was unaware of and was horrified) and constant people around that area. I highly recommend anyone visiting Vegas to stay at The Cliffs as it is home from home, a fabulous place and gives respite from the non stop lifestyle. Why pay more for a simple room in a themed hotel when you can stay in luxury with all home comforts/amenities? You would be mad to book anywhere but The Cliffs!!! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to experience all of Las Vegas and the surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: sandiegocamaro
Reviews.Content: This place has a nice living space, pool, fountains, jaccuzi or hot tub, great staff, free movies if you or the kids are needing some indoor entertainment. We enjoyed the comfortable bed and large closet. It even had a safe, most likely for the bigtime gamblers. The condos are neetly arranged and some have a poolside view. We did laundry in the condo as well as used the dishwasher. The kitchen is stocked with utensils to save you $ if you want to make your own food. They have large grill near the fitness center that are free as well. The business center had computers and free internet for our last minute plans. It's a short drive to Red Rock Canyon, and about an hour to Hoover Dam if I remember right. The strip was about 15-20 min and they had a free shuttle if you needed it, but we had a car. We felt much safer where we were than if we had stayed on the strip. What a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Soccer Tournement Gem”
Reviews.Author: revenueguru
Reviews.Content: Over President's day weekend we stayed in this very enjoyable Timeshare. My girls, 10 & 12, absolutely enjoyed the pool and hot-tub. Great patio bbq public area. It's away from the strip and that's a good thing with little girls. It's near a lot of branded fast food as well and close to the soccer complex.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: DoDoLeong
Reviews.Content: We travelled in family of 4, 2 adults w 2 kids. Read abt this timeshare from tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. It's away from "The Strip", but fine with us, the non-casino type and we had a car. Fully equipped room(laundry washer & dryer, kitchen appliance..) Swimming pool, BBQ pit... Stayed at the ground floor, near to pool, not noisy at all. Checking in & out service smooth and fast. Really worth the money and would like to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable timeshare”
Reviews.Author: krupskayab
Reviews.Content: Great unit. We had a 2 bedroom and the resort accomodated my family request to have side by side units. My sisters unit was a little nicer than ours - hers had updated flat screen tvs and a fireplace. Our kitchen was large and well equipped. Washer and dryer in unit. Two nice bedroom suites. Pool was heated and hot tub nice. Loved the gas grills by the pool. Several grocery stores and other retail stores such as Target, Sears, and Kohls less than 5 minutes away. I highly recommend The Cliffs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms; Annoying, Aggressive Timeshare Pitch”
Reviews.Author: meenooskis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week this past summer (July) at The Cliffs at Peace Canyon. We traded our timeshare for a week here. Overall, we're glad we came to the Las Vegas area, and we are also glad we chose this hotel. A minus for many, but a plus for us non-gambling types, this place is out of the way of "The Strip." We had the best of both worlds - a fantastic Cockney shuttle bus driver to get us to the strip when we wanted to go, but none of the noise of the strip. Another plus was the room in which we stayed. It was spacious, modern, new, clean, and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable, and the television received a lot of channels. The room also included laundry machines. The minus category includes a few elements: first, there was the aggressive timeshare presentation. We signed up for it to see what the big deal was and to get our "gift" for attending. After refusing time after time to take the timeshare, we were the last ones in the presentation, and the head manager of the timeshare scam actually started insulting and harassing us! They weren't good salespeople, anyway, because we told them that this trip was a fluke for us and we usually travel internationally. They answered, "Okay, so let's say you've always dreamed of going to Branson, Missouri ..." Uh, no thank you! The second negative is that the pool and hot tub were so crowded with kids who were too young to be there - like, diaper kids. Ew.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements obvious!”
Reviews.Author: FehrLadyAllentown_PA
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 4th visit to the Cliffs and I'm glad we did. I always liked the location away from the strip, but we did detect deterioration in the units and this was our first time back since 2009. Our two BR unit was much improved with newly upholstered furniture, remodeled bathrooms, a kingsize very comfortable bed in the Master BR and nice linens. We enjoyed our stay! There is still a need to add WiFi access to all units, no charge. We travel quite a bit and most hotels, resorts, offer this service. They do have a computer room available to guests, with a 15 min. maximum. The computers are slow and when I prepared to print boarding passes for the return trip, I found that the computers completely shut down after 15 min. I had to log on again to complete the action. I thought that was very rude and I would have made an effort to get off ASAP. There actually was only one other guest using the computers (4 computers available and 2 laptop stations) at the time. I also thought that the next step is to provide better TV's, hopefully flat screen. This was our first visit in January, and therefore we spent more afternoon down time in the unit vs. laying around at the pool, so we really missed these conveniences. The staff was very polite and when we needed info they always responded. The individual who was disappointed at only one cleaning, obviously has never stayed at a condo timeshare. This is typical and the Cliffs staff did a fine job. I suggest that the ownership keep making improvements and we won't hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: drjsanchez
Reviews.Content: I got a 2 bedroom unit, which was clean and well equipped. Unfortunately they only cleaned it once during our 1 week stay at mid week. The pool was tiny, no bar or restaurant on premises. They tried to sell us a unit for 32k, plus yearly maintenance fees, which was ridiculous, as you can get one on e-bay for a dollar. It's quiet at least, way out of the strip. There are stores and a few restaurants within a 5 minute drive. If you went outside it looked like an average neighborhood, you would never know you were in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: jaade
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect during our stay, but were pleasantly surprised with the comfort and amenities at the Cliffs. The unit was very quiet (we stayed on the 2nd floor) and provided everything we needed for our week in Vegas. We didn't use the pool (simply because we were busy every day). There was less pressure about time share presentations than other places we've stayed at (we simply say "no thanks" once and that was it). We were within walking distance of major shopping centres and a few restaurants, and for our excursions further out, we took the shuttle service. Steve, one of the shuttle drivers, was a wealth of information, friendly, and funny (in a word, "awesome").

Reviews.Title: “lovely retreat from the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Foster7204
Reviews.Content: we had time share points and a special deal to use by a certain date. I am not usually a Las Vegas person, but this time share was off the strip, had good reviews and liced up to all of them. We had a great two bedroom apartment. The operative word here is apartment. This was an apartment complex ,that was bought by the time share company. We had so much room, a lovely balcony and a huge kitchen( we like to eat breakfast in when using time shares) so we had so much fun!!! The pool area was very relaxing with a bar b que area, hot tubs and lovely waterfalls. The exercise ,facilitites were ok.. the elliptical was broken and no one could tell me when it would be fixed..still broken at the end of the week, but there were two treadmills and stationery bikes, as well as weight/resistence machines. would go back

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in West Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Thomas L
Reviews.Content: I was leery of this place because it seems it is always available and it was so far out. But it is a nice clean complex just a short drive down to the Strip, it is also just 15 minutes from some great mountain bike trails and the scenery of Red Rocks Canyon. The unit was clean and well maintained and the staff was great, it was a pleasure to stay there and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort and good location”
Reviews.Author: Pauldolling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cliffs in June 2011 and found the location to be ideal. We wanted to take the kids to the area of las Vegas without them being subjected to the more 'adult' side of Vegas. Being able to pop into the city but then leave was perfect for us. We mainly did excursions to other places and this was the ideal base for us. The kids loved the pool area and we had family nights around the pool cooking BBQ in the facilities provided. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Las vegas time share”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here. We had a blast. The kitchen really helps when you have a family and dont always want to go out to eat. A shopping center is close by. The pool and jacuzzi were an added bonus. We got a great deal at resortgetawaydeals.com

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: OliviaWomack
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at The Cliffs at Peace Canyon. The staff was very professional and friendly. The shuttle driver were also very friendly. They recommended places to go and places to eat. A shopping center was in walking distance. The Main Street Buffet down on Fremont Street was the greatest! We enjoyed shopping at the Outlet Stores.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: Reserved crib in advance for baby. Was told it would be in room. Arrived at midnight, no crib. Front desk said nothing she could do until morning. Next morning, was told NO CRIBS AVAILABLE. I complained. Crib arrived at 11 (no cribsheet). Never saw manager or cribsheet. Very very stressful.

Reviews.Title: “A good get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: Momthetravelagent
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Cliffs at Peace Canyon. Went with a friend for a few days. The plan was to hang by the pool more than hang out at the strip. Unfortunately the weather didn't co-operate so we went to the strip more than we had planned. They had limited shuttle service to Las Vegas that never worked for us, so we rented a car. The plan was to see other things around Las Vegas like,the Grand Canyon, Red Rock Canyon, and Valley of Fire. We saw some of what we wanted, Red Rock Canyon was beautiful and very close to the resort. The Condo/room was very clean and spacious with two bathrooms and two bedrooms. It was nicely furnished but the space itself was fairly dated. Probably if the weather had been better we would have enjoyed our stay more. Don't think I'd go back, although there was nothing wrong with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sdmutton
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet place off the strip...This is for you.. beautiful view of the Red Rock Mountains ... Shopping is 2 blocks away for groceries or Target and Kohls Dept stores ... This resort has pool, hot tub and lots of shady pergolas, tables lounge chairs to rest and relax after a great day of hiking .. They also offer a shuttle to the strip ,Freemont Street , or groceries everyday .. All units are only 2 floors high ...Excellent Staff .....Large units ... WE had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom slept 6 .. We will definately go back to the Cliffs at Peace Canyon

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but designed by a corporation.”
Reviews.Author: vehoc
Reviews.Content: When Mitt Romney said that corporations are people, America's robots all tipped him 15%. Cliffs is better-than-average for the money, a vast improvement over anything on the Strip, but still committed to the MacVacation model. Like everywhere else in this town, complete ripoff "internet access." Also, love the way RCI positions heavy furniture in front of electrical outlets...didn't really need that phone charger or laptop, did you. Wish these places could be designed by people who actually know stuff, instead of, yknow, Republicans.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE STAY @ CLIFFS!”
Reviews.Author: KYMom45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cliffs July 8 -15, 2011 and had an excellent stay! After reading some of the reviews I wanted to comment that we had absolutely no encounters with any pests in our one bedroom unit. It was clean and very comfortable. We had zero pressure from anyone on the timeshare issues - in fact no one ever even asked us. I would definitely recommend Cliffs as a great, quiet & peaceful place to stay. What we liked most was the location- less than a mile to the expressway and an easy drive to the strip. There is a multitude of stores and restaurants within a block or two, yet you are in a suburban neighborhood. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a RCI Gold Resort”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: My family and I picked Cliffs @ Peace Canyon to stay for our timeshare exchange at RCI. We wanted to stay at another timeshare but could not get it. We wanted a 2 bedroom unit and we managed to get it at this timeshare and for the timeframe that we wanted. The timeshare complex is a 2 storey building with no elevators. I had elderly people with me and we wouldn't have made it up and down the stairs for the 1 week that we stayed there. I asked for a downstairs unit and luckily, it was available. I had read somewhere that the units around the pool area is noisy so we opted for one in the corner of the complex. We get our own parking spot under an awning. That keeps the car a little cooler. The unit it self was quite spacious especially the master bedroom and the ensuite bathroom and walk-in closet. I liked that. What I didn't like was the bed, kinda lumpy and soft. The bathtub was really nice and big. I liked that! My parents slept in the guest bedroom and they complained about the noisiness of air con unit outside the unit...and my parents are hard of hearing!! The pull out sofa bed was also used and it was all right. Lots of bedding were provided to make the sofa bed. One big plus: location of the resort is right by a huge mall - Kohl's, JC Penney, Sears. Lots of restaurants in the area. A 10 min drive to Red Rock Casino.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: KrisMcBride
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I thought I would try this timeshare. We already own a timeshare so I was prepared and did not allow them to pressure us into attending the presentation. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, with my in-laws staying in the 2 bedroom downstairs from us. When we went to our rooms, the upstairs and downstairs entryways were blocked with about 10 bags of garbage. We had to call the desk to have maintenance remove the garbage. Not a good first impression. Then when we finally got into the room, it was not finished being cleaned. The couch was pushed away from the wall and when we pushed it back, dirty carpet and candy was found underneath. The pillows did not have covers on them, but later than evening they were dropped off in our room when we were out to dinner. BE AWARE OF COCKROACHES EVERYWHERE AROUND THE RESORT. Do not leave the door open and don't dare go out on the patio. Three cockroaches made their way into our room. We called the front desk and they said they would spray, but we had to deal with seeing multiple alive and dead cockroaches the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "This is not a timeshare presentation" presentation!”
Reviews.Author: vacationfamily2011
Reviews.Content: The Bad: Bathroom had ants. Cockroaches in living room. Light in closet out. AC has service button lit. Pool towels felt like wet sandpaper. Swimming pool not heated and small and shallow. Spa was too small and jets were placed in strange places. No shade in pool or spa area. Unable to enjoy until suns goes down. Upstairs guests could be heard walking and making noise. The Timeshare Presentation was the worst! They promise you breakfast, lunch or dinner and a $90 visa prepaid card if you give them $20 so you put up with it only to find out that breakfast is in a box with a green banana, a bagel, a cup of coffee, a scoop of yogurt with some granola. This is Breakfast? After 2 hours, and countless NO's to the salesperson, her boss, his boss they finally let you leave. What a nightmare!!! It's up to you if you want to give up 2 hours of your vacation for $70 and a bad meal. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet peaceful oasis!”
Reviews.Author: ArcticGuy
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort for those who want to be away from The Strip and enjoy all the comforts of home. Had a one bedroom condo on the second floor. Very spacious unit with large living area, bedroom (with walk in closet), bathroom, kitchen, laundry room, and balcony. TV's in both living room and bedroom with a wide variety of channels. Laundry and dishwasher detergent supplied along with everything else you could possibly need! Cleanliness of unit was spotless! Shuttle service to The Strip went smooth and is about a 20 minutes drive. I would recommend renting a car as all stores, restaurants, etc are just a short drive away and a taxi from the airport is expensive from what I was told (about $45.00). Red Rock Canyon is a 15 minute drive and is spectacular! Very beautiful 13 mile drive loop with an entrance fee of $7.00 a car. There are several hiking trails along the way which are worth getting out for. Just be cautious for rattle snakes and black widow spiders as you walk (though I never saw any). The only negative thing I have to say is after checking in at the front desk, I had to see the concierge desk for my parking pass. The woman was quite pushy in me attending a free breakfast/lunch to promote their timeshares. I was expecting this but was not expecting her to ask if I was married or single as I felt this was an invasive question. I was traveling with my common-law spouse and felt uncomfortable with the question as the way she asked was as if she was trying to instill her personal beliefs on me. That aside, everything was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware-Thief is Present”
Reviews.Author: john_in_vegas22
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Cliffs the first week of July. All went well except for us being booked into and been given keys to a room that was still occupied. Other than that everything was good. On Saturday my family got up early and left for the airport for my elderly mother's return flight home. It was 6 AM . When we returned at 8:40AM we found that our room had been gone through. Not by an outside person but by "billy"in maintenance . DVD's, personal coffee maker,bottle of wine,bottles of water and an unopened card left by my mother for us to read after her depature. I promptly approached the front desk person. She asked all staff , finally contacting maintenance. The workers said that Billy had been in that room. Mind you there was no request for maintence to be there. Why would he go into our room in the morning ? We were returned the coffe maker and movies. Wine,water and card were not. We werent checked out and other personal affects were untouched. IIt was an honest mistake I was told by the head of maintenance. Thievery is what I called it. Travelers be cautious that you dont get uninvited maintence people into your room while your not there. Would not go back nor recommend The Cliffs.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WarEagleFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited LV with friends for a week. At the Cliffs we had a two bedroom two bath condo. It was very clean. The furniture was a little worn, but fine. I prefer a king sized bed, but the queen we slept on was quite comfortable. The light blocking curtains in the bedroom were fantastic! However, our friends' room had three square windows across the top of the wall in their room that let in light throughout the night. It was BRIGHT in there. We bought some aluminum foil and covered those after the first night. Not pretty, but problem solved. Since we didn't go to Vegas to gamble and do the night scene ONLY, we really enjoyed this place away from the hustle. I personally preferred to gamble at Red Rock Canyon Resort and Casino and Old Las Vegas on Fremont Street instead of the Strip. The dealers were friendly and the slots seemed looser...........? Although we rented a car to get to Red Rock Canyon(hiked there twice, 15 mins from the Cliffs) and the Hoover Dam (1 hour drive), we usually took the shuttle to go to the Strip or Fremont Street. What a convenience! The shuttle leaves roughly on the hour and drops you at the Mirage. You return on the half hour from the Mirage. One night we went to Fremont street from 6:00 until 10:30 on the shuttle. There are many great restaurants around the Cliffs. Our personal favorite was Rosemary's restaurant(elegant evening out), but Capriotti's(sandwiches) and Viva Mercado (Mexican) were excellent, as well. All of these places were within 5 to 10 minutes from the Cliffs. The pool area was very nice and clean. We enjoyed relaxing there several afternoons. Wifi is available for $10 per day, but when my husband called the provider we received a week's connection for $50. The front desk was always helpful and cheerful. They seemed quite happy to answer any questions we had. The only negative regarding this stay was the noise. There were several Large people who were staying above us. Lots of loud stomping that echoed through our ceiling and literally rattled the light fixtures whenever they were in their condo. Thankfully, I took along a pair of earplugs, so I managed to block out the noise at night. You might want to request a 2nd floor condo to avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: PatinCO
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Carpet needs shampooing, but otherwise very clean. Furniture is dated, but clean. Nice pool. Nice location, away from the strip (20 minutes), but near lots of shopping, restaurants, and the 215 beltway which makes it easy to get places. Checkin was easy, but of course, they want to treat you to lunch if you'll listen to their spield about the timeshares. We declined, of course, as we do at all the places we stay. Lots of good golf courses in the area. Although several nearby bars have video poker machines, full service casinos are only 5-7 minutes away, including, Sun Coast and Red Rocks. Having the full-size washer/dryer was nice. Not a lot of kids at this resort. Pool was almost all adults all the time. They could use a restaurant/bar onsite. That would be nice. Internet in the condo is $50/week, or use their business center for free, but the computers are really slow. You can take your laptop to their business center and use it though for free.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations, but a 20+ minute Drive to the LV Strip”
Reviews.Author: Johnny-Q2
Reviews.Content: Very nice 1 bedroom suite with a Full Kitchen with Full Size appliances. We got a good rate through Expedia for 4 nights. Pros: Close to Red Rock Canyon, close to Red Rock Casino, very nice room and furnishings. Cons: About a 25 minute drive, parking spot to parking spot, to the Strip. But if you have had your fill of the Strip from previous trips ( I have ), this is a good place to stay. I like Red Rock Casino more than any Strip Property. They had some free internet computers in the lobby, but no free WI-FI for the rooms. They did have a printer you could use, so that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: pjbulman
Reviews.Content: This was our fist trip to Las Vegas and we were glad to be away from the strip. The Cliffs were clean and quiet with good service. We enjoyed the pool area very much. There were many affordable resturant options nearby as well as many shopping options were available which made my wife very happy. We would go back the Cliffs again. We did some great day trips to the Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, and the Pahrump winery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ken98072
Reviews.Content: First the positives. This is a quiet resort away from the crowds and noise of the strip. It has a great shuttle service that will take you to and from the strip by simply making a reservation a short time in advance of when you wish to go there. The shuttle will also take you to a nearby grocery store where you can buy whatever supplies you wish if you decide to cook or barbecue while you stay. (We used the shuttle to get us to the resort in the first place because we had decided not to rent a car while in Vegas and so all we had to do was take a taxi to the Mirage from the airport and catch their shuttle from there). The rooms are spacious and clean, the kitchens are well stocked with whatever you may need if you wish to save money and fix your own meals. The pool is not spectacular, but is certainly adequate and includes a separate spa. The furnishing around the pool are very good. They also have a very nice exercise room, pool table and barbecues available for their guests use. Areas that I think need improvement are housekeeping. As stated above the room was very clean and I have no concerns there, however, our first night there the room next to us was cleaned and all the trash, dirty towels etc. were left lying on the ground next to our entry way. We called the front desk to alert them to this and they said they would have someone come and pick them up. Well that never happened, so this all sat outside our door over night until late the next morning. The resort also has an area near the pool where they encourage guest to recycle, glass, paper, plastic, etc. which I applaud. The only problem is that no one seems to have the responsibility of emptying the bins regularly, so on two occasions these bins were overflowing onto the sidewalk around the area including broken glass on at least one occasion. Secondly, the resort has a practice at check in of sending you to someone who pushes very hard to have you sign up for a "complimentary breakfast" which of course leads you into a sales pitch. The lady who pushed us into this assured us of no hard sale and no more than an hour of your time. Neither is true. The sales pitch took us an hour and half and that was only because we insisted on leaving at that point. Once the first salesperson is done with you they will send you to another "manager to sign off on your paperwork and then will send you to one more to get their final offer. Perhaps they have a different definition of hard sale than I do, but it sure fit my description. My advice is to just say no, although if you do you can be assured that they will not quit asking. If you do say no long enough they will probably raise their initial offer of what you will receive for subjugating yourself to the sales pitch. If you are in the market for the vacation time they are trying to sale to you, then do not pay the initial asking price which was $11,000 +, but was suddenly $3000 + when we had said no and were heading for the door. Finally, this resort has no free wireless. When free wireless is offered to patrons of Motel Six and other cheap hotels and motels and when it can be had at most customer friendly businesses, I can find no excuse for a place advertising itself as a top end resort to charge $10.00 a day for this service. No one wants to sit in your computer room to use the internet and then get booted off every fifteen minutes because of the time limits you have imposed on computer use there. Overall, I would go here again, but I would also look at other options first and seriously consider my choices before taking this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Las Vegas location off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mamabNePa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom condo unit for a week in early March. The unit was clean, quiet, spacious and comfortable. Furnishings were good quality and there was a fireplace in the living room. A mid-week cleaning is provided. The heated pool, spa and surrounding areas were also very clean and well maintained. It is about a 20 to 30 minute drive to the Strip and a regular shuttle service is provided for those without a car. We have visited Las Vegas several times in the past and stayed in hotels on the Strip, but wanted to try something different. This was more of a hiking vacation, and the location was convenient to Red Rocks, Death Valley, the Valley of Fire and several other parks as well as the casinos and restaurants on the Strip. My only complaint would be about the bedding - I do not care for the type of blankets they provide (vellux) and the sheets were a little thin, but that is a personal preference. Also, there was a fee of $50 for wireless internet access (cabled internet may have been free).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Quiet but close to the excitement!”
Reviews.Author: MsKiki3
Reviews.Content: In March of 2010, my husband and I were married in Las Vegas. My in-laws buy into a time share and the Cliffs at Peace Canyon happen to be a part of that. So of course we were willing to stay there! Not only do they offer a shuttle to and from the airport, but to and from the strip as well. Leaving every half hour if I am not mistaken. The rooms are beautiful, modern and clean. They are quite well kept by the staff as well. The pool and hot tub area are beautifully designed, and have a picnic, BBQ area available for your use right beside it. The lobby area was being renovated and painted during our stay. The lobby is also home to a pool table, and a free computer room. Cliffs at Peace Canyon is within walking distance to a small shopping area with stores such as Target and Kohl's as well as a salon and spa we went to for pedicures and manicures. It is also close to golf which is very important to the men on the journey, there were numerous courses in and around the area. There were a few little restauraunts in the area as well including a Joe's Crab Shack which was great :) Overall a very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Needs soap and water and pest control”
Reviews.Author: Traveldoc1942
Reviews.Content: Units are large and comfortable. Furnishings in living room need updating. Dishware is so old that white plates were grey from wear. Ceramic floors were dirty and bottoms of feet became black after shower.It is a distance from the strip but was ok for us to relax. We were close to pool and we complained after 10 pm and they said it is open until 12 am. Wife woke up in the middle of the night and stepped on a cockroach on the bathroom floor. We saw a couple of them on later days.Pool was somewhat heated but not enough to swim when the outdoor temperature was cool. Pool towels were so old they had partial frayed holes in a couple of them.This could be a great resort if someone used some elbow grease and cleaned and updated accessories and some furnishings. Too bad it could be a 5 star with good management. NEVER VISIT AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: trvlfan2010
Reviews.Content: We (2 minor children and 1 adult) loved this property asit is off the strip and quiet. It made for a very relaxing vacation. The 2 bedroom is very spacious. decorated beautifully and very comfortable. We stayed in the building closest to the office so the pool was very close. The condo is in a residentail area of town but close enough to the strip. You do need a car if you are staying here. There is no restaurant on site but many restaurants to choose from close by as well as a Target, etc if needed. The parking area is covered for shade. I was surprised there is only one pool area at this location being in the desert. The unit has a nice patio for eating. We would definitely stay at this condo again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Could Have Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: Callimazoo
Reviews.Content: We had a first floor one bedroom unit for a week. Very clean, comfortable and quiet. The key card didn't work the first or second time we tried it, but the front desk was very accommodating and immediately sent a workman to check and replace the batteries in the lock - that did the trick! Very easy to get to the facility from the Strip - we had a rental car and parking was right in front of our unit. Carport parking was also available so the car could be in the shade. Flat Screen TV in living room and 2nd TV in the bedroom. Pool was clean and not busy at 8 pm. We enjoyed breakfast on the patio each morning and even had a visit by a hummingbird. We used the washer/dryer twice during our stay. Loved the proximity to shopping and restaurants. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, great support staff”
Reviews.Author: BevSurrey
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing we found was the carpet and chesterfield in our unit could use a good cleaning. It makes me wonder if the bedspreads are cleaned often. Other than that, support staff was excellent, very quiet area as it is a long way from the Strip, however, transportation to and from was on time with super drivers who offered good hints regarding local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bigmelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in September along with another couple in a two-bedroom apartment. I agree with other reviews that it is a bit of a distance from the strip however that, to me, is an advantage as there is some respite following the hustle and bustle of that area. The resort does provide a free shuttle bus that drops you very centrally on the strip but that does have to be booked for going and coming back. There was a local bus service that served the resort but we never used this. Checking in was quick and easy but the guest services desk did seem more interested in getting you to take the tour of the sister resort at Grandview. We refused and there was no real pressure. The unit itself was clean and comfortable and well furnished. The living room consisted of a large sofa, T.V.and table and 6 chairs. It also had a small balcony but strangely only 2 chairs. The kitchen was a good size with a cooker, microwave, large fridge/freezer and dishwasher. The cupboard held a washing machine/dryer along with an iron and board. The main bedroom had a queen size bed along with a unit containing a large TV. The bathroom was en-suite and had a large walk-in cupboard used for clothing (great space). The second bedroom also had a queen size bed and large TV. The bathroom was just outside the room but still offered reasonable privacy. The unit was air-conditioned that worked very well. There were shops and restaurants nearby but generally a car was advantageous for getting to them. To walk took a leisurely 20 minutes and it was safe enough. Overall a pleasant place to stay and perfect if you don't want the strip all the time but if it is the strip you want then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It Very Much”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned yesterday from a one week stay here. We had a two bedroom unit as our son joned us for a few days. We liked the location and the accomodations were comfortable not plush by any means, very clean, and were well equipped with suficient amenities and supplies. The pool area is very nice, with sufficient shade to protect one from the blazing sunshine, with nice palm trees and waterfalls in the pool that give a feeling of tranquility. There is a computer room with 4 terminals. Though sales staff tries to lure one into a presentation, it is easy to rebuff them. Just don't show up at the sales desk for a "free" bottle of wine. The regular staff is ok, not especially helpful. The location is about 10 miles west of the "strip". I like this location and it is an easy drive to casinos in the west part of the city like Red Rock Resort, Suncoast and JW Marriott-Rampart. Strip is about 20 min. drive away - no big deal as it is a quick trip. Lots of supermarkets, restaurants and shopping very close. One should have a car rental to stay here though as the shuttle is really not enough. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “We would return.”
Reviews.Author: YearlyTraveller09
Reviews.Content: Cliffs at Peace Canyon is located in a good central area if you are looking for something outside of the "Strip". The 2 bdrm unit we stayed in was decorated nicely and the unit provided you with everything you would need for your stay. The only wish we may have had was to have two beds in the second bedroom for our two teenage boys. The pool was not overly large but at no time was it so crowded that we could not enjoy. The drive is very easy to the strip and only approximately 15 minutes away. Free parking on the strip is easily found. I would recommend the Bellagio for parking. It is central to other points and parking is close to the strip. What can I say about VEGAS! It has everything! Be sure to check out the numerous websites for Vegas prior to going so you are prepared as to what to see and do. So many things. Something for someone. When we arrived into Vegas, we rented a car and drove to the Grand Canyon. Something you should do. We stopped at Hoover Dam going and returning. I regret not taking a day trip to California. If you are RCI time share owners, this is a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: CatfromBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our second time staying at The Cliffs at Peace Canyon. Had an excellent time. Our room was facing the road which at times wal a bit loud, but the view of the mountains, just topped that - gorgeous. Billy our shuttle driver was so entertaining for our trips back and forth. It was a home away from home. I wish I could just pack up and move in there. Only 1 suggestion, wi fi in the rooms. It was great having a covered place to park the car. Looking forward to our return trip

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than an apartment complex. If that's what you're looking for, okay.”
Reviews.Author: 6-TRG-6
Reviews.Content: Compare your timeshare maintenance fees to the weekly rate for this place, you may be trading down if you go here. We've stayed at several other RCI Gold crowns, not sure how this rates so high other than it is quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip, which may be the draw. We stayed here in a 2 Bedroom suite with our kids for a family vacation to see some Vegas shows, Hoover Dam, Valley of Fire, with a swimming pool to come back to for a cooldown from sightseeing, so it suited our needs as a home base. Reading previous reviews here we asked for a second floor unit, away from the pool-- all GREAT advice, as sleep time was assuredly quiet. But, the beds are not queen size; more like Full. The cleaning service only comes once during the week to remove your trash bags, vacuum and wipe down and make beds (no sheet changeout), and they are very clear that they will not touch any surfaces or furniture that has any personal gear on it, so you have to clean up before they'll clean. Internet is NOT included: $50 extra for the week. No real "resort activities" here. The washer and dryer are helpful. The Pool is 3.5 to 4 feet deep only, but worked well for us and our kids; uses salt water control vice chlorine which was great. Gym has a universal weight machine, 2 treadmills, an elliptical and several exercise bikes: very clean and kept in good condition, just as you would expect for a small apartment complex. The brochures call this a "non-smoking" facility, but all that means is they don't allow smoking inside the units themselves. They provide ashtrays on each units' deck, and there are smoking areas near the pool, too. I don't consider this a non-smoking resort. All in all, I would call this a useful place to go as a base away from the Strip, almost in the suburbs. Low on amenities, but plenty of standard shopping nearby (Walmart, JC Penney). Not really a resort at all... except they do push a hard-sell on the Timeshare presentation (Grandview Resort / Vacation Village).

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.”
Reviews.Author: rannyfos
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with our stay here. The condo was very clean & spacious. Included in our stay was a mid-week "mini-cleaning" for no extra fee... something that most places we've stayed charged extra for. We liked the location, also. No complaints! There were also 2 golf courses that gave discounts to people staying here... Sienna & Red Rock (Arroyo). The spelling may be wrong here, but it's close.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: MurphyNh
Reviews.Content: There were six adults in our party (three couples). Check in was good. They have you go to a sales person to get your parking ticket. We got a two bedroom, two bath. We were all comfortable. Full size washer and dryer made it nice to use during the week and come home with limited dirty laundry. The dishwasher didn't seem to clean well for some reason. The coffee cups would go in and come out looking the same, stained with coffee. The ice cube maker in our unit was useless as the ice cubes it made tasted awful. Ruined a few drinks that way. We bought crushed ice. Overall, it was quiet, comfortable and suited our needs to a tee.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Option in Vegas - excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: JeninOttawa
Reviews.Content: Used a week of RCI time to stay at the Cliffs and explore Las Vegas and the surrounding canyons. The one-bedroom we were in was spacious - bedroom a bit small but it did have a tv in it in addition to the livingroom one. The kitchen was fully equipped and huge. Livingroom area very nice and overall the unit was like a one-bedroom apartment. The bathroom could use updating and maintenance but nothing critical. The resort itself has an adequate gym and pool. The pool is square and shallow and not much bigger than the hot tub, which is huge. The complex itself is well laid out for privacy, although parking may be far from your unit. We did hear the people above us on the second floor, but only rarely. Desk staff were friendly but hard-sell when it comes to pushing more timeshare sales presentations. We fell victim. It earned us $100 for our time but of course you don't get your time back when you're on vacation. The Cliffs are about 15 mins. off the strip, by car. You need a car to stay here, but close by is shopping, particularly grocery stores. Las Vegas is a very easy city to navigate through.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: ChuckyCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very spacious two bedroom complete with fireplace and large kitchen. Amenities include free billiards, swimming pool, workout room and free internet. Very quiet. Close to a Sears, JC Penney and a myriad of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Whistlinvaderr
Reviews.Content: Away from the hustle of the strip, quiet, clean, spacious, all units 2BR, 2 bath, washer, dryer, full kitchen, nice pool, has shuttle van back and forthe to and from strip, close to area with restaurants and stores, less than 20 minutes from strip, nice enough but not overly friendly staff, driver of van was awesome, other staff were nothing special but accessible, no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJlt
Reviews.Content: Lots of space, well stocked kitchen, good facilities. The pool and hot tub are open until mid-night, so if you're a light sleeper, get a room away from the pool. Otherwise, was a great place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: Midwest-t
Reviews.Content: Like some have said, it is a little rough around the edges, in need of some paint but overall very pleased with the resort. We had 2 units for a week for 9 of us. Been to Vegas many times staying at Strip and downtown. This was a nice relaxing break from daily casino exposure. Plenty of room at the pool compared to elbow to elbow at many casino pools. Great bar-b-que grills and outdoor space by pool and hot tub. Shuttle service to strip and Fremont street was handy. Staff was friendly and willing to accomodate. Only 45 minutes from Lake Mead. Found a great place to rent a pontoon for an afternoon of cruising and sand bar lunch. Also fast easy access to any activities you want. Will definitely book back with the Cliffs again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: islandd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Cliffs at Peace Canyon. We booked this trip as an exchange through RCI. If you are used to staying in Condo exchanges, I would say this resort is average to above average. For us, staying off the strip was a plus. It is close enough that you can be to the Strip or Fremont Street in less than a half an hour and we found Las Vegas very easy to navigate. The big plus is that it is a nice quiet neighborhood. Perfect for the lazy trip we had planned. Sleeping in and relaxing at the pool were peaceful and relaxing. I would give this resort a higher rating but the units are a little dated, the bedroom has a full bed instead of a queen, and there were several pool chairs that need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: HS58
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that we have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Cliffs at Peace Canyon....we had a great time. The 2 bedroom appartment was great, perhaps a little tired in places, but it was very clean, air conditioning was working the whole time of our stay. A dead battery in the smoke detector which was pinging was replaced the same day. Swimming pool was great as this could be used from 8.00 am till Midnight which was marvellous as the temperature was still in the 90's late at night. It was close to several supermarkets & eateries. It is about a 15-20 minute easy drive to the strip with free parking at all of the major hotels. While there, we travelled to the Grand Canyon, Death Valley, Hoover Dam & Red Rock Canyon. An Excellent holiday had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the strip, but close enough to get to the action”
Reviews.Author: lprstn
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Cliffs @ Peace, off the strip about 5 miles, which was perfect for a family like ours that didn't want to be directly on the strip the entire vacation. It had a small pool and hot tub, and the room was nicely decorated and large. Only problem is, it only has a queen sized bed in both of the bedrooms, and a pull out couch in the living room. The room had a large kitchen. Family sized washer and dryer. You were assigned parking also, but they had extra spaces. Also, if possible get a room near the pool its definately worth it. Our room was also on the top level which made it hard to take grocery up the 11 steps in the heat. They also had a pool table in the lobby, a comfortable tv room off the lobby and a computer room off the lobby that had about 5 computers available for guest. We went for July 4th and it was the best fireworks show I've ever seen. Definately worth it. We also took in some of the free shows and activities on the strip. The pirate show, the erupting volcano, the fountain show, the mardi gras parade and many other little sights to see. We were disappointed in Circus Circus ... too crowded and the place was dirty and over priced. However our day trip to the Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam and Lake Meade was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great for quiet time and family”
Reviews.Author: thybewitching
Reviews.Content: This is not a typical Vegas Strip location. Located about as far West as you can go and still be in the city. There is a free shuttle service to the Strip, downtown, and a grocery store, but I recommend a car. These condo style units are in a residential community. Relatively quiet, especially if you are not right next to the pool. There are plenty of stores and eating establishments nearby. This location is close to the beltway so getting around is easy. Decent interiors, carpet and furniture a little worn but clean. Warning: beds are Doubles. Very small if you are used to a Queen or King size bed. Great pool and hot tub. Acceptable fitness center. 2 of 3 free computers were out of order, the one working was not working well. Staff courteous and helpful, but stay at front desk. Lots of families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Peace at Peace Canyon”
Reviews.Author: Romance123
Reviews.Content: My 50th birthday surprise was a trip to Vegas and a week's stay at The Cliffs. The Cliffs are a bit older and the accommodations are dated, but, if you don't want to stay right on the strip but enjoy the convenience of gas, groceries and food close by, this is a nice place to stay. It doesn't have a lot of amenities to speak of, just a pool, bar b que area and minimal gym. We didn't spend a lot of day time at the Cliffs. We chose to use it mainly for a place to crash at night. Everything was at least adequate. The air conditioning system worked well, nice kitchen and laundry facilities. Well lit walkways and covered parking. All in all, it was a very nice place to stay. Our unit did have these high windows with no covering and it's daylight at 5:30 in the morning. We had to stuff pillows in each opening to make the bedroom dark.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ben_mac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one week stay at The Cliffs at Peace Canyon. We had a terrific stay. The minute we drove up to the front of the resort and saw the two-storey buildings, we knew that we were going to love the smaller scale. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom unit. The only gripe we had was the fact that the beds were only full size and not queen or double, oh well, we had to sleep a little closer together. The beds were very comfortable. Sure the resort is showing a little bit of wear in a few places, like the doors in the cabinetry of the kitchen and bathroom look like they need to be adjusted a little, but you can just imagine the useage they get from the number of guests. The kitchen was well equipped, fridge with icemaker, stove, dishwasher, dishes and cutlery, washer/dryer. They even provided some dishwashing detergent, dish soap, coffee filters and laundry detergent. The pool area was very nice with a cool pool, a hot tub, plenty of chairs and even four barbeques for the use of the guests. As I said, we had an excellent time, met some great people around the pool and will definitely go back. The hotel was a bit off the strip but could be reached by car in 15 minutes. The resort did have a shuttle service but we did not use it. The staff were very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to avoid the Strip, enjoy the family, this is the spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: doretti1
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old and 8 week old were driving to Las Vegas to see friends from college and have a get together. Being a 150 day a year traveller, I wanted something that was family friendly. This property was PERFECT. The Cliffs at Peace Canyon, is west of downtown Las Vegas, a comfortable twenty-minute drive by car. We stayed in a one-bedroom units, over 1044 square feet of combined living space, which was plenty od space. It had a full sized kitchen do we were able to buy some breakfast items and keep them in the fridge, which helped us save some money. We relaxed in the swimming pool and heated spa; worked out in the fitness facility, and they have a huge clubhouse. This property will be our place when we want to stay off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: reneemg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. We have teenagers and they are very hard to please. They absolutely loved it. It felt like being at home. The kitchen had everything you could possibly need. The beds were very comfortable, even the sofabed. The condo was very clean. It also had indoor laundry. Lots of ammenities.Lots of towels which was great because our teenagers forgot their towels for the pool. The pool is heated which was nice. It had a pool table inside the lounge area which my husband liked. If you don't like all the chaos of the strip than you would love to stay here. We needed some snacks and the good thing is that everything is so close. Target is right down the street. It was a good place especially for the price. And believe me I checked around. It really isn't that far from the strip, less than 10 minutes if that. We really enjoyed our stay and will be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo / Clean and updated / Parked right outside unit”
Reviews.Author: DanaYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cliff on April 2 for 3 nites. We were on the Harley for a HD HOG training that was at the Red Rock Casino. So, parking close was a great asset. The condo was perfect, Full kitchen with w/d in closet area, which I used. The bathroom was clean and nice size. The bedroom was large and nice sheets and bedding with a TV in amoire. Only thing bed was small for us. We have a king and nothing quite compares. So, I slept on the couch. Livingroom was beautiful and tv and gas fireplace to take chill off in evening. I would stay again. I did use the shuttle to downtown and was on time and nice staff. They did call one am for a presentation, I'm assuming, but I had appts and they never called again. Great Staff, helpful and gave my friend great directions when she got lost.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches at the Cliffs at Peace Canyon stay away...”
Reviews.Author: quiver1
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night stay through Hotels.com. When we checked into our room or condo we immediately noticed cockroaches behind the couch, in the closet and the bedroom. Some were alive, some dead. We instantly complained to the staff and they told us "Cockroaches were normal to see in Las Vegas and Florida hotels." I told them we didn't feel we should have to stay here and requested a refund. They told us they would only give us a refund for 1 night. They also said for us to leave our bags outside when we returned home incase we brought some roaches or eggs with us home. We were very upset and called Hotels.com which were absolutely useless. We were getting nowhere fast and still had to find a hotel for that night. Don't let their good reviews fool you and make the same mistake we did. You also won't get a penny back from Hotels.com. STAY AWAY FROM THE CLIFFS....Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler02
Reviews.Content: On this trip I traveled with my boyfriend and two friends. We are all in our late 20's. Before checking into the Cliffs I read many reviews. All in all, I found our experience to be VERY good, and found most of the reviews to be petty and negative. Upon checking in we were greeted nicely and were given the time share talk, however after quickly saying we were not interested we were able to walk away. This was done in UNDER 5 minutes. They did call us once during the stay to ask if we had been introduced to the time share opportunity and I simply said we weren't interested, NO BIG DEAL! The grounds on the Cliffs property were beautiful and the hot tub was GREAT! We also loved our 2 bedroom condo unit. While some things were outdated as another guest put it, we had no trouble making the best of everything we were given. We also spent minimal time in our room because we were always out sight seeing or enjoying the pool/hot tub, thus at the end of the day we had no complaints. It was wonderful to come back to a cool room with a stocked fridge and a comfortable bed. We also had no trouble with noise outside our room or with other patrons/staff. The only issue we had with the Cliffs was the distance from the strip. BUT, we knew this going into it! Thus we can't really complain. The shuttle ran from 10am until 11:30pm and two of the drivers were EXCELLENT! The other drive we did not so much care for, but oh well. Because we often stayed out later than 11:30pm it was a hassle and expensive to take cabs back to the cliffs. But, once again we figured this would be the case before we arrived. People also complained about making a reservation for the free shuttle, which was really no big deal. Usually the day before when we made our plans for the following day I called down to the front desk and made our reservation. We only had trouble one time the entire 6 days we there getting the shuttle we wanted. And even then, we just picked the later one, once again no big deal! I also made and changed many shuttle reservations the same day we were taking them. The staff is willing to be flexible for you if you are patient and friendly to them. In the end we LOVED the Cliffs. The only reason we would choose not to stay there is the distance it is to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: grammieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare through RCI. I guess I am spoiled with our home based timeshare in Orlando Florida, where there are so many more ammenities than the Cliffs. I would only recommend the Cliffs for single couples , newlyweds or older couples that want to relax the whole time in their unit. I am relieved that we didn't bring our children, otherwise it would have been a very loooong vacation. There was absoutly nothing for guests to participate in besides the pool & hottub. Although there was a pool table on site (if you play pool).I was very dissapointed that a $50 fee was assessed if internet was requested in your unit. Even Super 8 hotels give free internet?? We also received a sales call from a bank asking to lower our credit card interest rate. How did they get our individual unit #?? Although the unit was very clean and supplied with everything you needed for the week and the decor was lovely, the layout of the unit was questionable. Why would you have such a large closet in each unit. I would have used this space to maybe enlarge the bedroom for a king size bed. I am sorry to say that I would not stay at the Cliffs again.

Reviews.Title: “Cliffs at Peace Canyon - Middle of the Road for us”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeWithYou_7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:30 and were not able to get our room untiil 4:00, which is the posted check-in time, which was fine with us. We went to Red Rock Casino a few miles away to kill a few hours, and that worked out well. Once we got in our unit and assessed what we would need from the store, we headed to close-by Wal-Mart, which is also an enormous grocery store. Best to go with a specific list made in advance, otherwise you will be overwhelmed and spend hours there. The unit included two small boxes of laundry detergent. I always bring a few dryer sheets (how easy that is for packing), and I also bring my own small plastic bottle of detergent, just in case. There were four adults, so we did use all of it, although I imagine you could get more. There is a small bottle of dish soap in the kitchen, plenty of towels and potholders, paper towels, toilet tissue, and facial tissue is there, with excess in the vantities. There are also plenty of trash bags, but the bags are terrible quality and break easily, so be careful. The beds are all queen sized. I knew this before I went, so I want to say I wasn't disappointed, but I still was. Every time I trade my timeshare, we have a large king-bedroom and usually a whirlpool tub. I have king at home, so we found the queen a little challenging. My last few trades have also had amazing mattresses and great sheets. I did not find this to be the case at the Cliffs. One of our face towels in the master bath was so threadbare and grayish that it looked like a car washing towel. Nothing was plush, same for the pool towels. I hated the comforter and blanket on the bed, the scratchy, not comfy type. The room was small and wouldn't have accommodated a king bed, though, so there is nothing they can do about that. I was underwhelmed by the master bath. There was a long countertop but only one sink, and it was so low by todays' standards. Very dated. Shower was fine, great water pressure, and the tub was a bit oversized and quite comfortable. Minimal towels given. We didn't need to use any front desk services, but the people there seemed very pleasant. The pool area and hot tub area were just lovely, very well maintained, and the four built-in gas grills are fantastic. The area where the grills are is well lit and very clean. We grilled outside twice, and it was fantastic. Near the grills is an outdoor fireplace for those wanting to eat outdoors at the high-top table by the fireplace. If you like to exercise on vacation, the fitness center leaves much to be desired, in my opinion. Two treadmills, neither calibrated to the right speed or incline. The belt was loose on one of them, and they are dated . There are NO free weights at all. Two treadmills, 3 bikes, 1 eliptical, and a universal. The area is small and hot. People were propping the door open with the trashcan. No towels provided in the gym, and I can honestly say I haven't been to a resort through my RCI trades that didn't offer towels and cleaning solutions in the gym to disinfect the equipment after someone sweats on it. The fireplace in the living room of this two-bedroom unit was wonderful - turn on with a switch and really warmed you up nicely. The kitchen was equipped with what we needed for cooking. The cabinets and vanities should ALL be replaced immediately. They are old, rotting in parts, difficult to operate. There is nothing updated whatsoever as far as vanities and cabinets. I'm on vacation, I want to feel like I am being pampered. I read on Trip Advisor to ask for a second floor unit due to bugs. We did not see a single bug and we did have a second floor unit. The unit was very clean when we arrived. Horribly, at 5:00 a.m. or at 6:00 a.m. EVERY DAY, the maintenance people are dragging pool chairs around while they are cleaning - the noise is like nails on a chalkboard. And we were on the second floor!!!! They are noisily dragging trash cans around and pool chairs. It is not fun to wake up that early in the morning because of loud noise dragging around by your unit. The shuttle service provided by the Cliffs is TOP NOTCH. Their system is working wonderfully - you make a reservation to go to the strip or Freemont Street, and you have a seat on the van - a beautiful, comfortable van. Steve is an amazing asset to the resort, if you are lucky enough to get him as your driver. There are three drivers that we saw during our week. They are efficient and always on time. They'll drop you off to do grocery shopping, too, and come back for you. Extremely accommodating and easy to use. We had a rental car and still used the shuttle almost every day. Be sure to tip these guys. There is no free wifi in the rooms, kind of unheard of these days, but they do have a computer room where you can go online and print for free. I brought my laptop because I needed to check in with work all week, and it cost me $50 to have internet access in the room. If you are staying at the Cliffs, be sure to visit Red Rock Resort and Casino - it is lovely. Check out their pool area, beautiful! The casino is really nice there, and it's only about 10 minutes away (you'll need a car, the shuttle doesn't go there). In closing, although we had a wonderful vacation, enjoyed the weather and being with our friends, had a fun time in Las Vegas, this is not a resort we would chose again in the future. With the maintenance fees and dues we pay for our timeshare, we can get much better. I think we actually lost money on this trade, as I imagine we could have rented it for less than our fees and trade upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, almost runined by presentation though”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Sussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel or resort is lovely. Would thoroughly recommend it. Staff are so helpful and polite, rooms were brilliant, spacious and clean, pool was a godsend and also the hotel put on a free shuttle to the strip which was excellent if you booked early enough to get on it because the strip is around 20 minutes drive. However, if i went again I would hire a car because where the resort is, its very easy to drive in and also driving onto the strip is fine. Yes its busy but the traffic is fairly slow and also all the large hotels offer free parking so it would have been easier to have gone to which ever hotel you wanted to visit this way. The only downside to this hotel is the presentation they get you to attend regarind time share. They are extremly pushy and it took 4 people before they seemed to understand the word no! It took up 2 hours of our short time in Vegas and they were trying to persuade us to take out finance or a loan in order to take part which i think is very irresponsible. So if you visit just say NO :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place..”
Reviews.Author: Sue0121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this resort the day after Thanksgiving. We reserved this unit through an RCI exchange. Our unit was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. It was nice and large. It was a little disappointing that the master bedroom did not have a king size bed, but I knew this going into it and after I saw the size of the bedroom, a queen bed is really all that would fit. The unit was simply furnished, with huge closets. It looks like this complex was not a purpose build timeshare place, it looks like it was probably a residential property prior, but it was still very nice. My only complaint was the tile in the showers was not cleaned properly. There was a lot of mold/mildew in the corners. This is something a good cleaning would take care of. The location is about 15-20 minutes from the Las Vegas strip, but our main purpose of going to Las Vegas was not the strip. It's a great location to Red Rock Canyon which we visited, and Red Rock Casino is only a couple of exits away if you want to do the casino thing. They have a huge bingo hall it was a lot of fun. I've never played "big time" bingo before. 13 games in one hour, what a thrill! We did not swim in the pool, but it looked very nice and other people were in the pool, so I assume it was fairly warm. We did go in the hot tub and it was nice after a day of hiking. There is a great place close by for breakfast/lunch it's called Eggworks. Just ask the front desk for directions. You definitly need a car at this location. It's easy access to the interstate, which can take you to Hoover Dam (30-40 minutes). While we were in Las Vegas we also took advantage of kayaking below the Hoover Dam with Desert Adventures. Did flightlines through Bootleg Canyon with Bootleg Canyon Flightlines. A couple of places we ate at were Todd's Unique Dining in Henderson and The Bistro in Boulder City. This was a fantastic vacation and would highly recommend this location to anyone that is looking for something different to do in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-Strip Secret!!”
Reviews.Author: hteteachr
Reviews.Content: The Cliffs is the perfect place to stay if you want to have your very own Vegas condo! Equipped with full kitchen, living room, dining area and washer/dryer this is a home away from home. The bathroom was nice and the bedroom had a closet the size of most NY apartments! Great pool, small but comfortable. Near all the hidden treasures of Vegas, would stay here again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cliffs!”
Reviews.Author: cryetti
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas numerous of times (mostly on the strip) but this was my first time staying at the Cliffs (off the strip). Because I had already done the entire STRIP in the past (you know, visiting the hotels, watching the shows, gambling) I wanted a place that I could just relax and unwind. The Cliffs is just the place! The room was a nice size, clean, spacious and had all the amenities. The living room had a nice L-couch, other chairs, a large TV, coffee table. The dining room and kitchen were a nice size as well. As with most timeshares, all pots/plates/utensils are provided. We didn't pig out at the buffets in Vegas this time. We just bought some grocerries at Smith's supermarket (the shuttle can take you there.. just ask the driver) and we were able to eat dinner at "home." There is free DVD rentals (not so many choices), there is a computer lab, workout room, BBQ area, jacuzzi, pool table and beautiful pool. There were a few brave souls in the pool, but I was freezing. When I was rested, I took the shuttle to the strip for some quick gambling and to watch the Bellagio fountains. The shuttle is a godsend. Not having to drive up and down the strip in Vegas is a great thing!!! Everything was wonderful here and I had a great time. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: tmmartindell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week for our honeymoon in July 2008. The rooms are really nice and spacious, although some of the furniture can be a little on the tacky side. They have a shuttle that runs from the hotel to the Bellagio (mid-strip) every hour. The best part, its completely free except for the tip to the driver. The staff was very friendly and the pool was really nice as well!

Reviews.Title: “could have moved in!”
Reviews.Author: Joyussbride
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a one bedroom for a week. We loved everything about our stay at The Cliffs. The unit we stayed in was very nice. Everything was new, very spacious, and clean. The pool and jacuzzi were close by and both were maintained very well. The location was east of the strip, and yes you probably should rent a car and not depend on taxi`s but you can then take advantage of the nearby stores and strip malls that had everything you need when staying at a time share. The strip itself was about fifteen minutes away with lights and depending on traffic. The Cliffs gave a nice getaway from all the lights and noise of the strip, so going back and forth was well worth the time. The staff were great, I called a few times because we were getting married and they were all very helpful and friendly. We can`t wait to come back and we will book with The Cliff at Peace Canyon again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peace at the Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: JeniferOttawa
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Cliffs at Peace Canyon. Stayed there between September 30th and October 9th, 2008. This was our 2nd stay there in the last 3 years and would recommend it to anyone. It is only about a 10 minute drive from "The Strip" and about a 15 minutes drive from "downtown". We rented a car for the period and it was great being able to "go home" after a day of sightseeing & gambling. Car rentals are the way to go because you don't pay for parking in LV so staying at the Cliffs is very convenient. The actual living space (2 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms/living room/dining room/kitchen/laundry room) was fully equiped with stove, fridge and dishwasher as well as a washer & dryer. The swimming pool & hot tub spa was great. There were gas BBQs and seating areas that you could enjoy with your family & friends. I can't say enough about this place. There were four of us celebrating birthdays and we split the cost 4 ways ($393 each)...you can't go wrong. The front desk & staff were fantastic! This place is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Employees”
Reviews.Author: jaxbikerbabe
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed to have found out that we left my husband's favorite jacket in the hall closet of the unit where we hung it when we arrived. Realizing we left it there, we immediately called as soon as we got home. They said no jacket was found. We can't believe someone took interest in it. One of the employees who went in the room after we checked out stole the jacket. It was a nice Harley Davidson jacket. This is not the first time we left something in hotel rooms, but they were always returned. They have a thief working in this property. How can you trust your valuables when you leave your room.

Reviews.Title: “Give peace a chance!!”
Reviews.Author: bazzag61
Reviews.Content: Second year at Cliffs. Love the excitement and character of "The Strip" but delight at the sedate atmosphere at the Cliffs. Just what you want. 15 mins by Shuttle to the action. What more can you ask for? Clean, friendly. Ok the room was a little "tired" but still great. If you Want action-Stay on the strip! If you want to stay in the room-stay at home! If you want a Holiday-Stay at Cliffs!! Hoping to return from across the pond next year. Barry, Debbie, Carole & Bob

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
